resources.string: 30 Days of Mental Wellness for IT

string-array.name: tip_titles
string-array.item: Server is Down, So Should You
Code is Poetry, Rest is Priority
Release the Pressure (But Not the Code)
Hello, World! It’s Time to Celebrate

string-array.name: tip_descriptions
string-array.item: Sleep before you see double. Debugging on 3 hours of sleep is like coding with a blindfold.
It\'s okay to not feel productive every day. Take a walk. The code will still be there when you return (unfortunately).
Don’t push to production after 4 p.m. unless you really enjoy living on the edge.
Made a mistake? Undo it! Remember, there’s always a rollback in life (just don’t tell the DB admin).
Switch your focus to something non-work-related. Your brain isn’t a CPU; it needs time to cool down.
When the server crashes, it’s the universe telling you to take a coffee break, not a panic attack.
Restarting your machine works wonders, so try it for your mind too—power down for a bit!
Some problems just can’t be solved today. Null-pointer exceptions happen to the best of us. Sleep on it.
Give your mind a break. Who says you can’t be poetic in your error messages?
Step outside, breathe in some fresh air. Clear your mental cache before returning to the grind.
If you’re constantly crashing, maybe it\'s time to recompile yourself with some relaxation.
If you’re stuck in an endless loop of stress, remember: It’s okay to break (take a break).
Take a moment to check how you’re communicating. Is your “code” clear to others?
Life throws exceptions too. Learn to handle them with humor—try not to throw tantrums in the process!
When your mind’s cluttered with too much, don’t be afraid to “dump” some thoughts. Journaling can help!
Start your day right. Your first action sets the tone—whether that’s a coffee or a crash.
Multitasking is a myth. Focus on one task at a time. You’ll avoid a mental “denial of service.”
Take life one sprint at a time, but remember to retro and relax.
Sometimes the most important commit is committing to self-care. No merge conflicts here!
It\'s okay to ignore a few notifications when you’re focusing on your wellness. Do Not Disturb = Do Not Feel Guilty.
If your backlog is looking heavier than usual, remember: You can only lift so much. Delegate and prioritize.
Stay connected with your colleagues, but don’t get stuck in endless meeting loops. Your sanity depends on it!
Check in with yourself. Self-awareness is key to staying mentally strong.
Feel like your brain is running out of RAM? Close some tabs (both real and metaphorical).
Never push yourself to production if you’re running on fumes. You’ll crash, and nobody wants a rollback.
Sometimes you need a hotfix—whether that’s an impromptu day off or just 10 minutes of quiet time.
Take time to do nothing today. No bug fixes. No code reviews. Just you and some relaxation.
If you’re feeling overwhelmed, take a deep breath. The code can wait.
Sometimes you’ve got to hit pause and release the stress. Save the build for tomorrow.
You’ve made it! Reward yourself. Remember, you’re more than just your code. Celebrate your wellness wins!
